alert.note: Alert for Anchorage (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Watch issued January 01 at 7:11AM AKST until January 02 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON FOR NORTH AND WEST ANCHORAGE AND ALONG KNIK ARM... * WHAT...North winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph possible. * WHERE...North and West Anchorage and along Knik Arm, including downtown Anchorage. * WHEN...From Sunday morning through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...High winds could move loose debris, damage property, and cause power outages. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Expect wind chill values from 15 below to 30 below zero in these winds Saturday night and Sunday morning.
info.instruction: A high wind watch means there is potential for a hazardous high wind event. Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.
